title: Submission
description: A schema for the submission structure for RTMS project.

comment.description: Participant provided comment or description for the submission.

submissionReason.description: Free text to provide more explanation on the reason of a sub-sequent submission.

effectiveTradingDateFrom.description: The Trading Day from which the Standing Real-Time Market Submission will take effect.

effectiveDispatchIntervalFrom.description: The Dispatch Interval within the defined Effective Trading Date From from which the Standing Real-Time Market Submission will take effect.

comment.description: Participant provided comment or description for the submission.

submissionCode.description: Code to define the reason of a submission.

submissionReason.description: Free text to provide more explanation on the reason of a sub-sequent submission.

allowGateClosureViolation.description: Indication of whether the submission contains dispatch intervals within gate closure.

day.description: Object element to contain array of days of the week.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week the Standing Real-Time Market Submission applies.

tradingDay.description: Object element to contain array of days of the week.

dateFrom.description: Start Trading Day to which the following submission data applies.

dateTo.description: End Trading Day to which the following submission data applies.

facilityCode.description: The facilityCode for the registered facility to which the following submission data applies.

dispatchIntervalFrom.description: First Dispatch Interval to which the following price/quantity pairs applies.

dispatchIntervalTo.description: Last Dispatch Interval to which the following price/quantity pairs applies.

unconstrainedInjectionForecast.description: The expected MW level of Injection at the end of a Dispatch Interval for a Semi-Scheduled Facility or Non-Scheduled Facility, assuming that the Facility will not be subject to a Dispatch Instruction or direction from AEMO that limits its Injection. This must be a positive number or zero.

unconstrainedWithdrawalForecast.description: The expected MW level of Withdrawal at the end of a Dispatch Interval for a Semi-Scheduled Facility or Non-Scheduled Facility, assuming that the Facility will not be subject to a Dispatch Instruction or direction from AEMO that limits its Withdrawal. This must be a negative number or zero.

maxInjectionCapacity.description: Maximum Capacity (in MW) the Facility can send to the Network in the Dispatch Intervals defined. This must be a positive number or zero.

maxWithdrawalCapacity.description: Maximum Capacity (in MW) the Facility can receive from the Network in the Dispatch Intervals defined. This must be a negative number or zero.

inflexibleFlag.description: Indication of whether the Facility is only able to be dispatched for a fixed level of Injection/Withdrawal in the Dispatch Intervals defined.

maxUpwardRampRate.description: Maximum rate (in MW per minute) the Facility is able to increase its output from the commencement of the defined Dispatch Intervals.

maxDownwardRampRate.description: Maximum rate (in MW per minute) the Facility is able to decrease its output from the commencement of the defined Dispatch Intervals.

fsip.description: Parameters indicating a Facility’s MW capacity and time related dispatch inflexibilities for a Fast Start Facility.

t1.description: Time (in minutes) that the Facility requires following the receipt of a Dispatch Instruction to start varying its level of Injection or Withdrawal from 0 MW in accordance with the Dispatch Instruction.

t2.description: Time (in minutes) that the Facility requires after T1 to reach a specified minimum level of Injection or Withdrawal.

t3.description: Time (in minutes) that the Facility requires to be operated at or beyond its minimum level of Injection or Withdrawal before the Facility can be safely and securely returned to Injection or Withdrawal of zero.

t4.description: Time (in minutes) following the receipt of a Dispatch Instruction to return its Injection or Withdrawal from the minimum level specified to zero, that the Facility requires to fully comply with the Dispatch Instruction.

minimumLoad.description: Quantity (in MW) of Injection or Withdrawal that the Facility must be operated at or beyond during the period T3.

facilityCode.description: The facilityCode for the registered facility to which the following submission data applies.

dispatchIntervalFrom.description: First Dispatch Interval to which the following price/quantity pairs applies.

dispatchIntervalTo.description: Last Dispatch Interval to which the following price/quantity pairs applies.

maximumCapacity.description: Total quantity (in MW) of Regulation, Contingency Reserve or RoCoF Control Service the Facility is able to deliver for the defined Dispatch Intervals.

enablementMinimum.description: Level of Injection or Withdrawal (in MW) below which no response is specified as being available.

lowBreakpoint.description: The MW energy dispatch level below which the Facility cannot provide the maximum quantity of that Frequency Co-optimised Essential System Service which it is capable of providing.

highBreakpoint.description: The MW energy dispatch level above which the Facility cannot provide the maximum quantity of that Frequency Co-optimised Essential System Service which it is capable of providing.

enablementMaximum.description: Level of Injection or Withdrawal (in MW) above which no response is specified as being available.

trancheElement.description: Price-Quantity pairs and other components submitted for the defined Dispatch Intervals.

fuelType.description: The Facility's Fuel Type for the Tranche.

quantity.description: Quantity (in MW) offered in the tranche.

price.description: Tranche price (in $/MWh for Energy, $/MW per hour for Regulation and Contingency Services, in $/MWs per hour for RoCoF Control Service).

capacityType.description: The Facility's Capacity Type (Available or In-service) for the Tranche.

noticeTime.description: Time (in minutes) the Facility needs to deliver the Quantity offered as Available Capacity.
